fields.summary: Sorting of username (displayName) according to pattern "Lastname, Firstname"
Return issue url in REST api (JQL endpoint)
Need option to export query data as TSV and/or CSV
Update docs for <= JQL function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31487].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a blocking issue is resolved, all blocked issues should get notified of the change, so that people watching those issues can respond.


h3. Suggested Solution
There is no way to perform this natively in JIRA.
 
h3. Workaround 
The third party add-on [ScriptRunner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner/server/overview] (paid) provides a post-function for that: *Update blocking issues* ([source|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/builtin-scripts.html#_post_functions])
fields.summary: Notify blocked issues when blocker resolved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31486].
  {panel}

Copied from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-726

How to reproduce:
- try to import a big dump of e.g. Trac and set websudo timeout to 1 minute. If the upload and initial scan takes more time than websudo timeout, you will spot this problem.

See also https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=295308267
fields.summary: When the upload (for file-based importers) or the initial structure analysis takes too long, then due to additional websudo check (which breaks JIM) continuing importing is not possible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31484].
  {panel}

Copied from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-784 - see original issue for more information

As per the subject.

Steps to reproduce:

- Using Internet Explorer 8, go to the CSV importer;
- Select a valid CSV file to import;

Current behavior:
- The file doesn't seems to be loaded. You need to select the file many times to the importer load the CSV file. Sometimes it works, many times not (attachment "error-csv1.png").


Expected behavior:
- The file must be loaded.

Proceeding, when the file loads, you need to choose a project to import the CSV file. It fails again when choosing a project, and you need to select the target project many times. Finally, when you were able to select a target project, the "JIRA Field" is being cut on the 9th character:

(attachment "error-csv2.png")

And even after match the CSV fields against the JIRA fields and start the import, JIRA throws some errors like the fields were not correctly mapped:

{noformat}

Caused by: java.io.EOFException: No content to map to Object due to end of input
	at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ObjectMapper._initForReading(ObjectMapper.java:2433)
	at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ObjectMapper._readMapAndClose(ObjectMapper.java:2385)
	at org.codehaus.jackson.map.ObjectMapper.readValue(ObjectMapper.java:1598)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.web.csv.CsvFieldMappingsPage.doValidation(CsvFieldMappingsPage.java:85)
{noformat}

The same doesn't happens when importing with Chrome and Firefox. For both browsers it works just perfect, so I believe that it may be related to some Java script issue with IE8, but I'm not sure about it. Unfortunately I don't have a VM with IE9 for testing it too, so I'm not sure if the problem is also occurring on IE9.

Thanks in advance,
Lucas Timm
fields.summary: CSV Importer failing on Internet Explorer 8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31483].
  {panel}

Copied from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-883

Basically, the same problem reported on UPM-2723 also affects the latest JIM versions. When installing it on Tomcat version prior to 6 the plugin is not enabled, and the following is thrown in the logs:
{noformat:borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}

fields.summary: Installing JIRA Importers Plugin on versions of Tomcat prior to 6 fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31482].
  {panel}

When using CSV importer on Custom Field Label, the CSV is not importing Custom Field of *Label* type correctly. 

Copied from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-888 - see original issue for more details

+Step to reproduce+
# Create CSV files with multiple labels by entering each label in a separate column.
# Import as usual by specifying the column with Custom Field Label.
# Import Successful.
# *ONLY* the first value was imported in Custom Field Label.

+Expected Behavior+
*All* the value in the column configure should import and form multiple value for Custom Field Label.
\\
h4. This does not happen with *System Field* of Labels
fields.summary: CSV import doesn't import Custom Field Type Label Correctly.

fields.description: On the Create Issue Screen (default) all the fields are gone. It only appears the project and the Issue Type. The fields configuration it seems to be OK. It's the default one.
fields.summary: Lost Fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31480].
  {panel}

It appears that the Description field size is limited in Create Issue in Dialog Box and Edit In Line.

Ours tests show that as soon as the Description fields exceed a size between 1700 Kb and 2000 Kb, the submission of the action fails with "XSRF Security Token Missing".

Using the default old action (*Create Issue* link using the scroll wheel click under Windows or using direct access to http://hostName/jira/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa), we have successfully created description with a size of 8Mb.

Vincent
fields.summary: Create Issue (Dialog Box and In Line) with large text in description fails with "XSRF Security Token Missing"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31477].
  {panel}

The Browse files button appears differently in different browsers. It uses the browsers/system styling for the buttons.
!chrome.png! - Firefox
!firefox.png! - Chrome

A consistent look for each browser would increase consistent visual style in JIRA.
fields.summary: Attach files button not consistent across browsers
Proper documentation for JIRA to JIRA Issue Copy plugins (Remote copy plugin)
JQL query silently fails to return responses for 'not text ~ foo'
I cannot download greenhopper I keep getting the a...
Comment-by-email does not work for @mention emails
Use proper hierarchical field referencing for expanding fields instead of treating everything as a single level
As an Administrator I would like to manage private filter subscriptions
Deleting JIRA filter/project may break greenhopper boards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31464].
  {panel}

When sending mail to JIRA with ccassignee on, either the CC field or the second recipient (in the TO field) is made the assignee. If this user does not have assignable features, something else will happen, but this is not logged. For scenarios where there are multiple users with the same email address and one is assignable and one is not, we need the error to specify the user_name attribute for comparison.

Steps to reproduce:

# Install JIRA
# Create two users with the same email address
# Make one user assignable
# Configure handler/mail server
# Send email to JIRA cc assignee
# Confirm that no warning is in log
# Confirm that the created ticket is not assigned to CC
fields.summary: When ccassignee is not an Assignable user, no error is logged

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31463].
  {panel}

The message says that user is not active, which is not quite true, as it doesn't exists.

How to reproduce:
- go to administer project page -> roles
- try to add nonexistent user to project role (for example Administartors)
- error dialog will appear:

!new-error-message.png!
fields.summary: JIRA shows misleading error message when trying to assign nonexistent user to project role
The hide macro is not available in the documentation
JIRA REST API gives 500 error code instead of 400 error code with proper message when invalid expand value is passed to search JQL endpoint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31457].
  {panel}

Customer is receiving this message in the Issue Collector configuration page: 

"Issue Collectors will not record all the data submitted in the form, since the description and environment fields for the issue type are not present.
Field presence can be set up on Fields page."

It is confusing because in this case, only the environment field was not present.  When the customer goes to fix this, they would likely start with trying to figure out how to show the description field first, which would ultimately confuse them.  

It's also not blatantly clear that the system is telling you to enable the description and environment fields.  It is worded in a way that it leads the customer to think that they need to add additional unknown fields.  Maybe 'description and environment fields' needs to be bolded?
fields.summary: Unclear Issue Collector message - vague and also tells the customer they need to enable a field which they do not.
Ability To Customize The Default Filter Criteria Issue Navigator
Strip the domain name from users created via mail handler
Automatically open a new issue
Dashboards Sidebar truncated if it's longer than current Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Cloud connectors consist of these plugins.

A- Framework dependencies:
1- Core connector plugin version 1.2.3
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~rkrishna/Core+Connector+for+JIRA+1.2.3+for+JIRA+6.0-breakit

B- The Connectors plugins:
3- Connector for Salesforce and JIRA Version: 5.2.2.1
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~rkrishna/Connector+for+Salesforce+and+JIRA+Version%3A+5.2.2.1+for+JIRA+Version+6.0-breakit

4- Connector for Zendesk and JIRA 2.2.3.1
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~rkrishna/Connector+for+Zendesk+and+JIRA+2.2.3.1+for+JIRA+6.0-breakit

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~rkrishna/Connector+for+Get+Satisfaction+and+JIRA+2.2.1+for+JIRA+Version+6.0-breakit

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~rkrishna/Connector+for+uTest+and+JIRA+1.2.1+for+JIRA+6.0-breakit

They need to be upgraded together, otherwise any currently deployed version will break.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31435].
  {panel}

Current method requires:

1. Something requires mail to be stopped. This can be a mail loop, a dev server accessing the wrong email, etc.
2. JIRA server shut down
3. Add jvm email disable params
4. Start JIRA server back up
5. Troubleshoot issue
6. Shut JIRA down
7. Remove jvm params
8. Start JIRA back up.

Steps 2 and 6 result in loss of email in the queue. Restarting JIRA twice will waste 5-10 mins on shutdown startup time. While this is not a super high priority, it is an improvement which would be really nice to have when you are suffering from serious mail issues.

The current method also requires filesystem level access to the instance. A JIRA sysadmin may not have this level of access depending on org structure. This results in them having to bring in secondary administrators which further delays the time to act.
fields.summary: Add incoming mail shutoff button within the UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31434].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install 2x JIRA(tested on 5.2.3) with JIRA Charting plugin 1.10
# Create test project in first JIRA instance(source)
# Create custom field of type 'Time in Status'
# Export XML backup
# Initialize Project Import in second JIRA instance(destination).

h3. Expected Results:
Project import completes successfully. Our documentation states: "All the target JIRA system custom fields and the custom fields included in JIRA plugins supported by Atlassian (e.g. JIRA Toolkit, Charting Plugin, Labels Plugin, Perforce Plugin) are compatible with the Project Import tool."
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/Restoring+a+Project+from+Backup

h3. Actual results:
Project import fails with error 'Unable to import custom field 'Time in Status'. The custom field type does not support project imports.'

h3. Workaround:
Remove any reference to the custom field in the XML backup by following these steps:
- Unzip archive and search for the string 'charting'
- Remove custom field entry in the entities.xml file:
{code}
<CustomField id="10000" customfieldtypekey="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus" customfieldsearcherkey="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:textsearcher" name="Time in Status"/>
{code}
fields.summary: Project Import tool not compatible with JIRA Charting plugin custom field 'Time in Status'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31430].
  {panel}

We have been using jira for few years now, and most of our workers has uploaded their avatars to jira.
However we would like to start using gravatar (as we do in bamboo).
Currently there is no way to use gravatar without loosing few thousand avatars.

Could you please make to fetch gravatars and if gravatar is empty, then use local uploaded avatar.
fields.summary: Make jira use gravatar and localy updated avatars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31428].
  {panel}

We are experiencing some constraint with JIRA Restore procedure ...

In our database schema (ORACLE), we have defined a Read Only account dedicated to reporting done by BIRT. (GRANT SELECT ANY TABLE TO RO_ACCOUNT).

This configuration has been done on all env. (Prod, QA, Test, Dev.).

When restore of JIRA is done through XML, it appears that the Import procedure performs a delete/insert (with alter table in case of upgrade). It works correctly for us.

But the import of AO tables performs drop/create/insert, and the side effect is that the SELECT privilege is lost by the Read Only account.
I have again to check others added object (View, Stored Procedure) ...

Minimal wanted improvement : Documentation about such risk, some alert during the import procedure, ......

I think that it would be hard to see the AO import modified.

Thanks
Vincent
fields.summary: Database Restore done by AO Plugins
Page not Relevant

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31423].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
When the Description field had been removed from Screen Scheme (Create,View,Edit) and not *hidden* on Field Configuration, users will not be able to insert description on the screens. However, Description will still be shown on the issue itself. And clicking it returns no response. 

h4. Steps to reproduce
# On a fresh install of JIRA, go to {{Administration >> Issues >> Screens >> Screens}}. Configure Default Screen and *remove* Description field.
# Go to {{Administration >> Fields >> Field Configurations}}. Make sure Description field is not *hidden*.
# Create a project and create a new issue. On the create screen, description field is not available.
# Go to the issue and the field is there. But clicking it for inline edit does not work. (This is where some users thought that JIRA has a bug)

!description.png|thumbnail!

h4. Note
JIRA is running correctly. Just the description field is misleading.
fields.summary: Misleading Description field in issue after being removed from Screen Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31422].
  {panel}

Making Required a Cascading Select field, the validation should control all levels of the field as soon as the selected Parent option has Child options.

It should be the default behaviour !
	
Other behaviours, detailed in JRA-10302 are improvement ...
* Be able to have some Parent option where the Child selection is mandatory
* Be able to have other Parent option where the Child selection is optional
	
My current use case is to see a Cascading Select mandatory (all existing levels) when entered from UI (in Create Transiton) and optional when created by a Mail Handler.
* Using the native Required option where only the 1st level is mandatory, we obtain an unwanted behviour for creation done from UI, and it lets the Mail Handler create the issue with the field not entered (as we want).
* Using the workaround based on Jira Workflows Toolbox plugin, we can make the 2 Levels mandatory with the Validator : Correct for UI. The Required option is not needed here. But it blocks the creation by Mail Handler. 

V.
fields.summary: Cascading Select should be consistent related the Required option

fields.description:
With Date Format set to dd/mm/yyyy, if a user enter a Date in Date Picker field using the format dd/mm/yy, and then access to the Calendar, there is an auto-completion to dd/mm/yyyy based on a pivot around 2029.

But he validates the forms directly, on server side, the date is converted in dd/mm/00yy. 1/1/13 gives 01 Jan. 0013.

It would be useful to have the same behaviour on both side.

I tried a workaround using ALS and performing the JS conversion (Date.parseDate method) on Blur and KeyPress (key=13) events, but I have not success to identify correclty Date and DateTime Pickers.

V.
fields.summary: Date Picker has not the same conversion in Java and Javascript

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31410].
  {panel}

Hi,

We are a Java development company and we are using Tempo (via Jira) since a few years now. Since a few month, a signicative part of the development team moved (physically) to a customer house (as consultants).

At this company, we convinced them to use Jira and Tempo :-) So, they have bought Jira and Tempo and now, they are asking internal and consultant to encode the hours in their own Tempo.

We have now a mix system where : 
* employees working fully internally are encoding hours on our own Tempo 
* employees working fully externally are encoding jours on customer Tempo 
* employees working partly internally and externally are encoding in both Tempo the hours.

We would like to have a consolidated view on our internal developers (via Tempo) without asking the developers to encode both time (external and internal Tempo) the hours. We have seen that there is a possibility to use the import/export external hours but we would like to have your advice on this topics.

Thanks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31397].
  {panel}

If the size of the screen that is being used to access JIRA is small, it is possible that the 'More Actions' dropdown menu is not shown properly, or the user is unable to view the entire menu.

Note : This only happens in IE8, but not in Firefox.

Also, if the user uses a bigger screen, then the menu can be seen properly. (The tests where the dropdown menu is not able to be seen properly was done on a laptop, while if the user uses a desktop, it is shown fine)

This is shown in the following screenshots :

* The behavior in IE8 :

!IE8 (1).png|thumbnail!

* The behavior in Firefox :

!Mozilla.png|thumbnail!

* The behavior in a desktop :

!more actions desktop.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: 'More Actions' dropdown not shown properly if screen is small
As an admin, I don't want JIRA automatically assign project roles to the groups unless I specify that

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31385].
  {panel}

As of now, only emails creating comments can have regex settings that allow to truncate the irrelevant part of the message. It would be useful to be able to to the same when creating new issues from email.


*Example use case:*
JIRA is used as a support system. If the support team is contacted by their customer, they can send to them an email with the body beginning with something like:
{quote}
*--
Please write above this line.

Dear user,
Thanks for contacting support.
Please enter your issue description and attach relevant screenshots.

Thanks,
Your support team.

--*
{quote}

Reply to that email is received by Jira and triggers creating a new issue, with only the text above *-- as description.
fields.summary: Split regex in Create a new issue handler
Add JQL LIMIT support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31383].
  {panel}

We have defined for each transition own screens with some validation rules. For example we defined a transitions with a screen, with 10 custom fields and corresponding validation rules. So a user can only perform the transition if he fill out all fields. 

So if a employee tries to perform this transition a transition screen pops up which contains all 10 fields. The employee will fill out the first 9 fields. Now he realizes that he has not the information for the 10th field. This is a big problem, because he must press the cancel-button. The validation rule of the 10th field does not allow to perform the transition and a save/update of the current fields is not possible. So he has to discard all changes....

This is not really fine for the usability, because this is "idle power". He has to fill out all 9 fields again, if he knows the information of the 10th field... :-(

It would be great if we can have a save/update button (or a Cancel & Save-Button whatever) to prevent unnecessary work.
fields.summary: Save Button for Transition Screen

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31376].
  {panel}

Expected: The recipient's language should be used.

To reproduce:
Create a comment as a user with a language other than the system default (e.g Spanish). Set a security level on it.
As a user with the system default language (e.g. English), watch that issue, the user should be able to see the comment.
As the Spanish user, delete the comment.
Bug: The English user will get an email with the Spanish text "Se ha borrado un comentario con nivel de seguridad 'atlassian-staff'." instead of soemthing like "The user has deleted a comment with security level 'atlassian-staff'" (that text is probably not the actual English translation of that).
fields.summary: JIRA mail uses the sender's language instead of the recipient's language when sending mail

fields.description:
We are integrating Jira with one of other system and using SOAP API.
When calling updateIssue, randomly connection reset error comes and sync stops.

We debugged client's Jira instance and figured out that whenever current user sessions were going high, it resulted into connection error randomly.
(There were 9000 SOAP user sessions open even though we always do logout after calling any API.)

When open user sessions are low, we are not getting connection issue
fields.summary: Connection reset error coming randomly from UpdateIssue

fields.description:
The current Kuali Rice development project ReleaseNote query is not working correctly, as it pulls in JIRAs that are not completely fixed. 
https://jira.kuali.org/secure/ReleaseNote.jspa?projectId=10220&version=16606
It should limit the JIRAs to only those which have a resolution of Complete or Fixed. In addition, subtasks should be ignored. The following query will do this:
project = KULRICE AND fixVersion = "2.1.3" AND status = Resolved and resolution in (Complete, Fixed) and type != "Sub Task" ORDER BY priority, key DESC
fields.summary: Kuali Rice Release Notes Query Imporovement
Add parent issue link to email template if subtask

h4.Expected Behaviour

fields.description:
The following plugins are required by JIRA, but have not been started: Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Project Config Plugin (com.atlassian.jira.jira-project-config-plugin), Embedded Gadgets Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.embedded), Gadget Dashboard Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard), Opensocial Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.opensocial), Gadget Directory Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.directory), Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Gadgets Plugin (com.atlassian.jira.gadgets)


I have tried the answer on this page but to no avail.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installation+Troubleshooting+Guide


I HAVE RESOLVED THIS ISSUE.
IT WAS SOME PLUGINs TIMING OUT SO I FOLLOWED THE ADVICE REGARDING SETTING THE TIMEOUT PARAMETER FOR PLUGINS IN...

   <jira_install dir>/bin/setenv.sh 

I added...

    -Datlassian.plugins.enable.wait=300

Problems went away, now running fine.
fields.summary: The following plugins are required by JIRA, but have not been started
Bug in JIRA

fields.description:
We are using diffrent *security levels* in our jira system, because we are working with external partners who should not be able to see all comments in a jira issue.

The problem is:
When creating an new issue with *security level* _intern_ and *agent* _external user_ and *creator* _intern user_, the issue is created but our external partner cant see it in fact of the security level. (The correct *security level* would be _external_)

It would be nice to have a validation (checking security level and user/user group by creating an issue) for this problem (for example like the validation by the _watching issue_ function)
fields.summary: Checking the security level and the user by creating an issue

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31338].

Hi,

Since generally the "Create Issue" screens for our projects tend to have multiple tabs with lots of fields, when one creates a new issue he has to scroll down a bit to get to the last field on the screen. Though, what we've learned is that people tend to forget about the other tabs when creating a new issue since when scrolling down the tabs bar disappears. 

I think it would we of great help if the tab bar would have a fixed position (same as for the "Create Issue" banner at the top of the screen).

Thanks,
Petru

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31334].
  {panel}

A status change can be assigned one of two effects via a specific link type to another issue.
Effect 1 - set the workflow of the linked issue to a specific state and hold it locked
Effect 2 - set the workflow of the linked issue to a specific state but leave it free to be changed by the users

Use case:

Workflow with an additional "blocked" state.

When a link between issues is "blocks"/"is blocked by" then any state in the source issue other than resolved or closed sets the target issue to the blocked state and holds it locked.

If the source issue is set to resolved or closed and the target issue is in the blocked state, and there are no other block state dependencies, then the target issue is moved to the open state and the workflow of the target issue becomes free to change.

Value:

Chains of issues can be set up and their blocked and unblocked state can be seen quickly in an issues list. This mechanism can, of course, be performed in JIRA with a manual procedure and a modified workflow. However people are free to get it wrong and have to do some tedious editing when changing the state of certain key issues with lots of "blocks" links.

Note:
If multiple state forcings can apply to an issue from multiple links and workflow states there needs to be a priority ordering.
fields.summary: Automatic Status Change via Link Types
